column8:
Cloud Ready - review the Cloud Ready checklist.

In this section we provide links to content and topics which will influence some of the decisions
The cloud creates new paradigms for the technologies that support the business. Datacenters can be torn down and rebuilt with one line of code, we have to rethink traditional approaches.
Review the Azure Readiness Guide to become familiar with the tools and approaches needed in landing zone creation.

Update Cloud Adoption Framework Ready and Adopt doc.
Review landing zone considerations to understand the alternative decisions which could impact your landing zone design.
Start your Azure adoption by creating an initial set of subscriptions. Learn what subscriptions you should begin with based on your initial requirements.
Hub and spoke is a networking model for more efficient management of common communication or security requirements. It also helps avoid Azure subscription limitations.
Establish a plan for organizational alignment, included defined RACI diagrams.
Inventory digital estate and align outcomes. https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/cloud-adoption-framework/digital-estate/inventory?WT.mc_id=devops_userstory_service_sprg-inproduct-devopsportal
Plan template cloud adoption plan to manage effort and change.

Meet with key stakeholders and executives to document the motivations which are driving an interest in cloud adoption.
Consider classifying your priorities by horizon 1, 2 and 3.
Engage motivated stakeholders and executives to document specific business outcomes.
Develop a business case to validate the financial model supporting the motivations and outcomes.
Identify all the workloads / projects and update the Cloud Adoption Plan
